title: La Femme du Boulanger = the Baker's Wife
abstract: Note: Adapted from 'Aurelie et le boulanger' and 'Jean Le Bleu' by Jean Giono.
description: A village baker refuses to bake bread when his attractive young wife runs off with a handsome shepherd, a situation that forces the bread-less villagers to take action. Pagnol, combining the best of his humour with sympathetic characterizations of Provencal life, gives an individual drama of infidelity a collective dimension.  Credits: Producer, Charles Pons ; director, Marcel Pagnol ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Georges Benoit, Roger Ledru ; music, Vincent Scotto ; editor, Suzanne de Troeye. Cast: Raimu, Ginette Leclerc, Fernand Charpin, Robert Vattier, Edouard Delmont, Maxilienne, Robert Bassac, Marcel Maupi, Paul Dullac, Charles Moulin.
